intro: Baudouinia, commonly known as the common bird's nest orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family. It is characterized by its unique, bird's nest-shaped inflorescence, which consists of a dense cluster of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and rocky areas. Baudouinia species are found primarily in the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
